result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Roman G Drymalski in court with ASL Interpreter, Sandy Peplinski who is sworn by the Clerk.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Roman G Drymalski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA TenHaken. Called @ 3:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was before the Court for plea hearing as to all files, 22CF64, 21CF530, 21CM488, 21TR3045, and 21TR3093, but Attorney Lettenberger requests that matters be set off the call as it will be plea and free to argue sentencing. Court sets as requested. Court in recess. Interpreter to be scheduled. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant in court with attorney Frank Lettenberger. ADA TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. ASL interpreter Sandy Peplinsk, duly sworn by clerk, appears. Matter set over for plea. Minutes filed.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roman G Drymalski in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Roman G Drymalski. ASL Interpreter Sandy Peplinski sworn by clerk. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:41 AM Case called. Defendant Roman G Drymalski in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Roman G Drymalski. Atty TenHaken appears for the state. ASL interpreter in court. 
22CF64 waiver of prelim. 
Deft understands the charges and penalties. 
Prelim waiver form filed, court reviews form with the deft. 
Defendant advised of right to & waive Prelim hearing. 
Court binds over on the felony. 
State will file information after court. 
Not guilty plea entered by counsel. 
All files set over for a status. 
Scheduling order to be sent via efile. 
No victims present. 
Status hearing set for June 15, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2696.

2:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Roman G Drymalski in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Vivian TenHaken in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Roman G Drymalski. 
Court in session for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant needs an  ASL Interpreter. 
Interpreter was not scheduled for today's hearing.
Attorney Lettenberger informs the Court defendant Preliminary Hearing will be a Waiver, requesting date before the Judge.
No objection by the State.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CF64, 21CF350 AND 21CM488

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.B.E.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall continue with treatment program and one on the wait list for. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Roman G Drymalski appeared in court, Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger appeared in court for Roman G Drymalski. ASL Interpreter Kate Block previously sworn by clerk. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Lettenberger. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
